arm_group.description: Exendin 9, 39 will be infused at 300pmol/kg/min in either first intervention period or second intervention period.
A saline infusion will be administered in either first intervention period or second intervention period.

brief_summary.textblock:
The study is being undertaken to understand how the Roux-en-Y Gastric Bypass procedure can
      affect insulin secretion after meals. The hypothesis of this study is the Disposition Index
      is decreased in subjects who had previously undergone Roux-en-Y Gastric Bypass by
      glucagon-like peptide-1 (GLP-1) receptor blockade.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Contribution of Incretin Hormones to Post-prandial Glucose Metabolism After Roux-en-Y Gastric Bypass

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria Roux-en-Y Gastric Bypass (RYGB)Subjects:

          -  Subjects who have undergone RYGB

        Inclusion Criteria Healthy Subjects:

          -  Must match RYGB subjects in age, weight, and gender

          -  Subjects will be without active systemic illness

        Exclusion Criteria all Subjects:

          -  Subjects <20 years old and >70 years old

          -  For Female Subjects: positive pregnancy text at the time of enrollment or study

          -  Subjects with functional or organic bowel symptoms.

intervention.description: Exendin 9,39 is a competitive antagonist of endogenous GLP-1.
A saline infusion will be given to match the study drug infusion.

clinical_study.official_title: The Contribution of Incretin Hormones to Post-prandial Glucose Metabolism After Roux-en-Y Gastric Bypass

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: The total disposition index equals the product of insulin secretion and insulin sensitivity.
primary_outcome.measure: Change in Total Disposition Index from Study 1 (Exendin 9,39) to Study 2 (saline)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

collaborator.agency: National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Basic Science
